h1: Calories in a Bottle of White Wine

disclaimer: Nutrition varies by wine type, sweetness, alcohol content, brand, and serving size. Check labels or databases for specifics.

quick_answer.text: A standard 750 ml bottle of dry white wine has about 615 kcal, mostly from alcohol and carbs.

faqs.q: How many calories in a standard glass of white wine?
faqs.a: About 120-150 kcal for a 150 ml pour from a dry white wine bottle.

faqs.q: Does white wine have more calories than red?
faqs.a: Similar; dry white is ~82 kcal/100 ml, dry red ~85 kcal/100 mlâ€”sweetness increases both.

faqs.q: What contributes most to calories in white wine?
faqs.a: Primarily alcohol (~7 kcal/g) and carbs/sugars; dry varieties have fewer carbs.

faqs.q: How many calories in a bottle of Chardonnay?
faqs.a: Around 600-700 kcal for a 750 ml bottle, depending on if it's dry or oaked/sweet.
Dry white wine has ~2.6 g carbs per 100 ml, making it relatively low-carb compared to beer or cocktails.
